dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, big news dropped yesterday regarding Julian Assange. Uh, the investigation into those rape allegations against him? It's officially closed.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, big news dropped yesterday regarding Julian Assange. Uh, the investigation into those rape allegations against him? It's officially closed.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Sweden is reopening an investigation into allegations of rape against Wikileaks founder Julian Assange.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, really? Oh my gosh, that's, like, huge. I thought that case had been hanging over him forever.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, really? Oh my gosh, that's, like, huge. I thought that case had been hanging over him forever.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I know, right? It's been, what, since 2010? And here's the kicker â€“ the victim's lawyer actually requested it be halted back in April.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, right? It's been, what, since twenty ten? And here's the kicker - the victim's lawyer actually requested it be halted back in April.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The announcement landed Monday, after the lawyer for the alleged victim requested in early April the Swedish Prosecution Authority look into the case again.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Oh, wow. So, even the victim's side was, uh, pushing for it to end? That's surprising.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, wow. So, even the victim's side was, uh, pushing for it to end? That's surprising.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it is. And remember, Assange himself admitted to the allegations initially. He's been, like, holed up in the Ecuadorian embassy for seven years, trying to avoid all this.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it is. And remember, Assange himself admitted to the allegations initially. He's been, like, holed up in the Ecuadorian embassy for seven years, trying to avoid all this.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Assange, who denies the rape allegations first made in 2010, has faced numerous legal actions over the last month.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Seven years, can you believe it? And he even had, uh, a banquet for his bail conditions just last month, didn't he?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Seven years, can you believe it? And he even had, uh, a banquet for his bail conditions just last month, didn't he?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Having spent seven years in the Ecuadorian embassy in London, where he'd taken asylum to avoid extradition to Sweden, Assange was sentenced to 50 weeks for breaking his bail conditions at the start of May.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: He did! And then there was also that whole exoneration by the U.S. government regarding the Chelsea Manning conspiracy. So, why now? What was the Swedish prosecutor's official reason?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He did! And then there was also that whole exoneration by the U S government regarding the Chelsea Manning conspiracy. So, why now? What was the Swedish prosecutor's official reason?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He was also indicted by the U.S. government over an alleged conspiracy with Chelsea Manning to crack the password of a military computer in order to steal sensitive files.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, they actually reopened the case in 2017 with new evidence. But the, uh, prosecutor's office now says they found "no avenues to properly investigate the allegations."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, they actually reopened the case in twenty seventeen with new evidence. But the, uh, prosecutor's office now says they found no avenues to properly investigate the allegations.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Swedish prosecutors had initially dropped the case in 2017, after deciding they'd exhausted all possible avenues to properly investigate the allegations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] No avenues? But didn't he, like, agree to cooperate at one point?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No avenues? But didn't he, like, agree to cooperate at one point?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That Assange had refused to cooperate was one significant factor in the case being suspended, the prosecutor's office said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's what the article says, which makes it even more confusing. But basically, no European arrest warrant will be issued.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's what the article says, which makes it even more confusing. But basically, no European arrest warrant will be issued.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Swedish prosecutor will issue a European arrest warrant.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so Sweden is out of the picture. But what about the U.S.? I thought that extradition attempt was still a thing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so Sweden is out of the picture. But what about the U S? I thought that extradition attempt was still a thing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, that's the really murky part. The article says "hearings into his possible extradition to America have concluded, and extradition is impossible."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, that's the really murky part. The article says hearings into his possible extradition to America have concluded, and extradition is impossible.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Hearings into his possible extradition to America have begun, but will likely take months to conclude. ... The outcome of this process is impossible to predict, said deputy director of public prosecution Eva-Marie Persson.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Impossible? So, he's just, like, free then? From the U.S. too?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Impossible? So, he's just, like, free then? From the U S too?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, not exactly. It also says that if there was a conflict between a Swedish warrant and a U.S. request, U.K. authorities would decide against pursuing *either*.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, not exactly. It also says that if there was a conflict between a Swedish warrant and a U S request, U K authorities would decide against pursuing either.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the event of a conflict between a European arrest warrant and a request for extradition from the U.S., U.K. authorities will decide on the order of priority.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right. But there's no Swedish warrant now. So, that complicates things even more for the U.S.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. But there's no Swedish warrant now. So, that complicates things even more for the U S.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. The deputy director of public prosecution, uh, Eva-Marie Persson, she basically confirmed the Swedish case couldn't proceed concurrently with the U.K. proceedings.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. The deputy director of public prosecution, uh, Eva-Marie Persson, she basically confirmed the Swedish case couldn't proceed concurrently with the U K proceedings.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, in my view the Swedish case can proceed concurrently with the proceedings in the U.K.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. So, they're not even gonna interview him in the U.K. It's just, like, done.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. So, they're not even gonna interview him in the U K. It's just, like, done.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Persson said investigators will ask for an interview with Assange in the U.K., but noted it would require the Wikileaks founder to cooperate.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much. So, what's next for Julian Assange? That, uh, that remains to be seen.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much. So, what's next for Julian Assange? That, uh, that remains to be seen.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah. This whole saga, man. What a rollercoaster.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah. This whole saga, man. What a rollercoaster.
